Generation II.Gold: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit.
Generation II.Silver: Even in the most vicious storm, this Pok é mon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.
Generation II.Crystal: It loves violent thunder. The space between its horns flickers bluish-white when it is charging energy.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Even in the most vicious storm, this Pok é mon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pok é mon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
Generation III.Sapphire: Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pok é mon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
Generation III.Emerald: If it touches metal and discharges the electricity it has stored in its body, an Elekid begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
Generation III.FireRed: Even in the most vicious storm, this Pok é mon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit.

Generation IV.Diamond: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can't store the energy it makes.
Generation IV.Pearl: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can't store the energy it makes.
Generation IV.Platinum: A weak electric current flows between its horns. Sticking a hand there shocks the unwary.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it only charges up a little bit.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Even in the most vicious storm, this Pokémon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.

Generation V.Black: A weak electric current flows between its horns. Sticking a hand there shocks the unwary.
Generation V.White: A weak electric current flows between its horns. Sticking a hand there shocks the unwary.
Generation V.Black 2: Spinning its arms around to generate electricity makes the area between its horns shine light blue.
Generation V.White 2: Spinning its arms around to generate electricity makes the area between its horns shine light blue.

Generation VI.X: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can't store the energy it makes.
Generation VI.Y: Spinning its arms around to generate electricity makes the area between its horns shine light blue.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.

Generation VII.Sun: When it's in a house, electrical outlets serve as its baby bottles. It sucks down electricity.
Generation VII.Moon: This Pokémon is constantly fighting with Togedemaru that try to steal its electricity. It's a pretty even match.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: When it hears the crash of thunder, Elekid's mood improves. It can be useful to record that sound and play it when Elekid's feeling down.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: When its horns shine a bluish white, that's the sign it's fully charged. You'll get a shocking jolt if you touch it!

Generation VIII.Sword: When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder, it gets full-on rowdy.
Generation VIII.Shield: It's not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémon sneaks into people's homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can't store the energy it makes.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can't store the energy it makes.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: They generate electricity by spinning their arms. During a thunderstorm, if one hears the lively voices of children out in the wilderness, what one is actually hearing are the voices of Elekid.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It loves violent thunder. The space between its horns flickers bluish white when it is charging energy.
Generation IX.Violet: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it only charges up a little bit.

Generation III.XD: In-game trade for purified Togepi or Togetic
